story:
It's my Ramen

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
What Is This?

You may be wondering why you're here, and what the point of all this is? The Rook Oshawa is a new Cafe experience coming to Downtown Oshawa in Winter 2021. Lovingly created by some of the fine folks behind Brew Wizards Board Game Cafe, The Rook Oshawa plans to bring you some of that same magic, but... different. Boasting delicious locally sourced food and drink,  a comfortable, relaxed atmosphere, and all the Pinball you could ever need, The Rook Oshawa will always give you a reason to come back! As we open a new destination for you downtown Oshawa, during COVID-19, we are determined to bring you the best experience possible. 
 

What We Need & What You Get

Let us be clear, we are ready to open our doors when the time comes. We have been working tirelessly for months to ensure that everything is perfectly splendid for our patrons when our doors open for you. The goal of this campaign is to raise some funding for some awesome branded merchandise for you all to take home with you when you come to visit. This will also help us set aside some funds to help us get through our opening months during the economic downturn of the COVID-19 Pandemic and have savings for any unexpected expenses that you can never account for. Also: Awesome Branded Merchandise! 

This is a flexible goal campaign so every dollar we raise, whether we meet or goal or not, will be given to us.   

Depending on your donation level you can get some really cool items, including:
T-Shirts
Mugs
Bags of Coffee
Hoodies
and even our super exclusive Coffee Club Membership! 

*Unfortunately due to cost, items will be unable to ship and will be local pickup only, but it gives you an excuse to come to visit us! If you absolutely need the items to be shipped send us a message and we can probably work something out!* 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!

Every little bit helps and during this weird global predicament we find ourselves in it's not always easy or doable to set aside extra money to pledge to a crowdfunding campaign, but we appreciate all the help we get!  

  • Follow us on social media! @TheRookOshawa on Facebook and Instagram.
  • Share this campaign and our socials with your friends!
  • Visit us when we're open, and bring your friends.

We're hopeful with your help, we can show how much we love our community! Spread the news, grab some merch and rep "The Rook" everywhere you go. 

Thanks - From the bottom of our hearts.

The Rook Team

story:
The Idea

Bake & Brew is a multipurpose space in the classic Sarbet neighborhood of Addis Ababa, Ethiopia. Offering quality roasted coffee alongside our specially crafted menu, we aim to create a memorable experience for all. Our second floor, retro fitted Mezzane will serve as our co-working space and startup display store for some of our favourite Ethiopian products and artwork.

We've designed Bake & Brew in a way where creativity and community can really flourish, hosting some of the city's most creative events; everything from art expos, movie nights, guest chefs, poetry evenings and much more.


Help us bring this vision to life! 

To bring this vision to life we are looking to raise £20,000 ($25,000). 

This is going towards the finishing touches and buildout. 

And for everyone who donates we will be offering some extra special perks:

£10 - Thank you!

We appreciate it so much, you have the choice between a hug, a fist bump or a kiss on your next visit to the Coffee House.

£25 - Welcome to the Bake & Brew Fam

You will receive regular updates and news on the status of this project and some of our favourite recipes.

£50 - Get your picture on the founder’s wall!

We will create a piece of artwork on which your name and picture will be displayed for all to see, for years to come to celebrate all who played a part in bringing Bake & Brew to life. 

Other perks below this amount are also included!

£100 - Soft Opening Invitation 

Before our Grand Opening, we'll host a Soft Opening, where you can try our coffee and food products and be the first to see our brand-new space! 

Other perks below this amount are also included!

£200 - Coffee Cupping Experience for Two + Grand Opening Invitation 

You will be invited to our in-house coffee cupping experiences.

Other perks below this amount are also included!

£300 - Bake & Brew Coffee Gift Pack

Our very own Coffee Beans, the Bake & Brew Poster and some others special bits as well as a personal thank you video from me. 

£500 - Coffee for the Family

Bring your family and join us to go coffee cupping with our suppliers followed by a meal at the new Coffee House! 

Other perks below this amount are also included!

£1000 - Bake & Brew Custom made Sweatshirt and Mug

You get a sweatshirt and a mug that has our name and logo on it, as well as all the perks before this too: Coffee for the Family, and Bake & Brew Coffee Pack and more!

£2000 - Bake & Brew Members Club

You'll be part of a select group of people who can get a free coffee (drink a week) for our first year! As well as all the other coffee perks above: Coffee for the Family, and Bake & Brew Coffee Pack and more!

£5000 - No gift is enough to say thank you.This level of generosity is life changing. So much so we'll name a table after you.

story:
What we do:

First and foremost, we are here to make a Damn Fine cup of Cold Brew. For too long, people have been served cold brew coffee that is bitter, overly fruity and over-extracted. We plan to change that. After years of testing with different beans, roasts, grinds, ratios, methods and magic, we have finally come up with what we believe to be the perfect cup of coffee, hot or cold. Cold brew coffee isn’t just for spring and summer. Just because it is brewed in the cold doesn’t mean it has to be served cold. With our coffee, you can enjoy the less acidic, less bitter, full-bodied flavor of cold brew, steaming hot or ice cold.

Secondly, we want not only to thrive as a business, but to thrive as a community. Through donations, sponsorship and community outreach events, we plan on doing just that. We take pride in being a Veteran-Owned business, and we want to give back as much as we can. We will be working closely with the local Veterans Administration Hospital to provide anything we can to support our Veterans. We will also work closely with other small businesses in an effort to locally source our ingredients.

Overall, we just want to make the world a happier place. We believe that with love, compassion, and some Damn Fine Cold Brew, we’re well on our way.

Why we're different:

Most of the cold brew we've tried has one fundamental flaw: Grinding up beans and letting them soak in water for 12-24 hours. That method technically works, but it doesn't make for a smooth, velvety, well-balanced cup of cold brew. Too long of a brew time can bring out a back end of bitterness with every sip. We've modified our brew time to yield exactly the flavor we are constantly looking for when trying different cold brew. Instead of putting our brew in the corner and letting it sit - out of sight, out of mind - we monitor each batch to ensure that it is brewing exactly the way we want it to. One of the reasons people over-extract their cold brew (simply brewing it too long) is so that they can make it as strong as possible. However, it's not just about the time. Time needs to go hand-in-hand with proper temperature and an even mixture. We don't let the grounds just sit on top, they need room to breathe and get to know each other so that ALL of those flavors can come alive! With our proprietary method, we have greatly shortened the brew time, while also delivering a good, strong kick. This means faster production of a higher quality product, and who doesn't want that?

Where your money will go:

We are already fully licensed in Denver, ready to start brewing and selling. We just lack the necessary funds to make every aspect of our Damn Fine dream a reality. We will be using YOUR contribution for startup costs (kitchen space, supplies, materials, advertising, and popup events to promote our coffee), building our coffee truck (before we build our brick-and-mortar shop, we want to build a coffee truck to travel around Colorado to events and festivals), and above all else, building the future of our business. We want to create a long-lasting community through our company, and we can't do it without you.
 

Who we are:

James Austin & Jordan Sweeney

James is a Marine Corps Veteran from New Jersey. For his service in Afghanistan, he was awarded a Purple Heart, Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder, and a Traumatic Brain Injury. In his spare time, he is an editor for The Magnus Archives podcast, as well as a karaoke enthusiast.

Jordan grew up in several parts of New Jersey and South Carolina. She's worked in a handful of industries such as food service, sales, customer service and retail. She most recently went to school for digital film, and is currently working on a few film and photography projects.

James and Jordan fell hard when they were in school together. They decided to leave their corporate jobs to create something beautiful from the ground up to be proud of and share with coffee lovers everywhere. Help us share our Damn Fine Cold Brew with the world!

Please feel free to reach out to us for business inquiries, more information, or just to say hello!

info@damnfinecoldbrew.com

 

Many humble thanks,

James & Jordan
King & Queen of Cold Brew

Cold brew coffee isn’t just for spring and summer. Just because it is brewed in the cold doesn’t mean it has to be served cold. With our coffee, you can enjoy the less acidic, less bitter, full-bodied flavor of cold brew, steaming hot or ice cold.Secondly, we want not only to thrive as a business, but to thrive as a community. Through donations, sponsorship and community outreach events, we plan on doing just that. We take pride in being a Veteran-Owned business, and we want to give back as much as we can. We will be working closely with the local Veterans Administration Hospital to provide anything we can to support our Veterans. We will also work closely with other small businesses in an effort to locally source our ingredients.Overall, we just want to make the world a happier place. We believe that with love, compassion, and some Damn Fine Cold Brew, we’re well on our way.Why we're different:Most of the cold brew we've tried has one fundamental flaw: Grinding up beans and letting them soak in water for 12-24 hours. That method technically works, but it doesn't make for a smooth, velvety, well-balanced cup of cold brew. Too long of a brew time can bring out a back end of bitterness with every sip. We've modified our brew time to yield exactly the flavor we are constantly looking for when trying different cold brew. Instead of putting our brew in the corner and letting it sit - out of sight, out of mind - we monitor each batch to ensure that it is brewing exactly the way we want it to. One of the reasons people over-extract their cold brew (simply brewing it too long) is so that they can make it as strong as possible. However, it's not just about the time. Time needs to go hand-in-hand with proper temperature and an even mixture. We don't let the grounds just sit on top, they need room to breathe and get to know each other so that ALL of those flavors can come alive! With our proprietary method, we have greatly shortened the brew time, while also delivering a good, strong kick. This means faster production of a higher quality product, and who doesn't want that?Where your money will go:We are already fully licensed in Denver, ready to start brewing and selling. We just lack the necessary funds to make every aspect of our Damn Fine dream a reality. We will be using YOUR contribution for startup costs (kitchen space, supplies, materials, advertising, and popup events to promote our coffee), building our coffee truck (before we build our brick-and-mortar shop, we want to build a coffee truck to travel around Colorado to events and festivals), and above all else, building the future of our business. We want to create a long-lasting community through our company, and we can't do it without you. Who we are:James Austin & Jordan SweeneyJames is a Marine Corps Veteran from New Jersey. For his service in Afghanistan, he was awarded a Purple Heart, Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder, and a Traumatic Brain Injury. In his spare time, he is an editor for The Magnus Archives podcast, as well as a karaoke enthusiast.Jordan grew up in several parts of New Jersey and South Carolina. She's worked in a handful of industries such as food service, sales, customer service and retail. She most recently went to school for digital film, and is currently working on a few film and photography projects.James and Jordan fell hard when they were in school together. They decided to leave their corporate jobs to create something beautiful from the ground up to be proud of and share with coffee lovers everywhere. Help us share our Damn Fine Cold Brew with the world!Please feel free to reach out to us for business inquiries, more information, or just to say hello!info@damnfinecoldbrew.com Many humble thanks,James & JordanKing & Queen of Cold Brew

story:
WHO WE ARE
John, a native Texan, acquired a farm in Dutchess County, NY in 2014. It was all he had dreamed of: a little piece of heaven with forested lands, a small orchard, wild fields, a large pond - and surrounded by wetlands. His wife Frederique, born French, was with him at this start in this farming adventure. She quickly found herself gardening and slowly began re-introducing herbs, fruits and vegetables. Initially for fun and to feed her little family, she soon discovered the full potential this land had to offer! John & Frederique have blended, tasted, cooked with and served many of their herbs and are now ready to share what Mother Nature blesses them with every year with others!

OUR MISSION

HEALTHY, HUMAN & NATURAL, WE MEAN IT

LAUNCH OF A NEW PRODUCT LINE

Our Mint, Lemon Verbena, Chamomile and exclusive Melanges promote better health, digestion and sleep. Grown completely pesticide- and insecticide-free, they make perfect herbal teas all year long. Sold fresh during the season and dried during the winter, our herbs are also a fantastic addition to any professional chef's kitchen - They can also be a creative one to your cocktail library. Herbs are a healthy and delicious way to season foods without the extra calories.  "Some herbs every day keeps the doctors away!"

WHAT WE NEED TO GET STARTED THIS SEASON

We are raising $7,500 for start up costs:

  • License & Registration, USDA and Organic Certifications
  • Website & Marketing Campaign
  • Labels & Packaging 
  • Fencing (to keep our friends the deers away)
  • A small greenhouse with heat & irrigation System
  • A temperature controlled herb drying machine
  • Mulch , Compost, Seeds, Small plant starters...

If we don't reach our fund-raising goal in 2017, the greenhouse will be acquired in 2018.

WHAT WILL YOU GET 

To thank you for your support and contribution, Lone Oak Farm Herberie will send you:

  • Samples of our Herbal Teas: Mint, Lemon Verbena, Chamomile
  • Samples of our Melanges: Melange de Jour (Mint-Verbena) & Melange de Nuit (Chamomile- Verbena)
  • The Perfect Accessories to enjoy and drink our herbal teas
  • Samples of our Fresh Herbs*
    *Only available for New York State Residents
  • A Summer day at Lone Oak Farm**
    **Limited to 2 persons- Light refreshments & Herb tasting included

YOUR IMPACT

  • You will help fund and promote NY local and sustainable farming
  • You will helps us protect our land and rivers from chemicals and other harmful treatments
  • You will help us protect NY wildlife, NY water and NY local businesses
  • You will help at large save our planet and educate new generations on herb properties and their natural health benefits

RISKS & CHALLENGES

Let's face it. Mother Nature can be capricious and we won't try to fool her...Severe droughts, late or early season freezes, pests or natural diseases can all affect organic and sustainable farming. But these last two years have been very successful, and the soil has been constantly nourished and fed by our pond even during the warmest months. 

OUR PROMISE

To only sell the best and most natural herbs in the an environmentally friendly way, and to share our harvest with our friends, neighbors, the bees, and the birds

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

  • Spread the word for us
  • Use Indiegogo Share Tools
  • Visit and Share our website www.loneoakfarmherberie.com
  • Like us on Facebook and Instagram
  • Post  @LoneOakFarmNY, #LoneOakFarmNY, #LoneOakFarmHerberie
  • Register to our Newsletter/ Mailing List
  • Join us and volunteer your time with us during the harvest season

story:
What is our story?

Hi, my name is Lindsey Gant! I am the  fresh-maker of The Dandy Line Kitchen and a graduate of Hope Rises. What is a fresh-maker you ask? It boils down to the fact that aside from my experience at Dandy Line, I have never been a formally trained chef. Despite my lack of formal training, I have a passion for making fresh food and serving others. I love to take food that can be seen as "weird" or "unconventional" and blow people's minds. I want to open people's eyes to this kind of food, and inspire them to expand their horizons or even just to try something different that just happens to be good for them.

I am a graduate of Hope Rises, a non-profit re-entry home. Prior to entering the program I had been in and out of prison. I had an addiction that consumed my life and I didn't have the tools or the support I needed to overcome it. I met the founder of Hope Rises, Kim Roxburgh, while still in prison. She taught an empowerment class and helped me see what I was capable of. I moved into the Hope Rises house and began a new journey.

At Hope Rises, all of the residents are required to eat clean, non-processed foods and cook for each other. That's where I began building confidence in my cooking abilities. I would try new recipes and make variations of my own. It became exciting for me! 

But enough about me, this is who WE are, and where We come from.

Over time, I went from cooking in the Hope Rises house to running a meal prep delivery service now known as The Dandy Line Kitchen!

Currently, we have two employees, including myself, and one volunteer. We serve between 45-50 regulars a week. Our client base has been steadily increasing over the past two years, but we have hit a point where we need more resources in order to serve more.

We cater to individuals, families, businesses, events and you can even find our meals and other goodies at The Green Corner Store, a local sustainable living store.

All proceeds benefit the Mission of Hope Rises: Providing holistic services to women impacted by poverty, addiction, trauma, or incarceration to improve their health and wellbeing and provide opportunities for personal growth and empowerment.

At The Dandy Line Kitchen we hope to create more employment opportunities for the graduates of Hope Rises to create, invest, and grow in a local business. These experiences are more difficult to come by for them and they deserve that chance. 

    Dandy Line Dreaming

    By donating to The Dandy Line Kitchen Expansion, you will be contributing to our move to a new location where we will not only be a meal prep delivery service, but also a cafe vendor at the local law school.

    Here is what we need:

    • New equipment for the kitchen
    • Dining area furniture
    • Startup costs
    • Funds to pay cafe workers until momentum of sales is established

    What's in it for YOU?

    In addition to contributing to our growth and our mission, you have the opportunity to try some of our products yourself!

    • The first 5 to donate $25 will receive a half dozen muffins of your choosing! (options: Gluten-Free Blueberry, Gluten-Free/Vegan Carrot Apple, or Gluten-Free/Vegan Lemon Poppy Seed)
    • The first 5 to donate $50 will receive a dozen muffins of your choosing! (options: Gluten-Free Blueberry, Gluten-Free/Vegan Carrot Apple, or Gluten-Free/Vegan Lemon Poppy Seed)
    • The first 3 to donate $100 will receive one full week of meals!
    • The first 3 to donate $250 will receive one full week of family packs!

    What else?

    As of right now, I do most of the prep work with the help of a one other payed employee and a volunteer who aid me in delivery and distribution. As we grow we will need more hands on deck, and with that, the money to supplement their salaries. Any money raised over our goal will allow us to kickstart pay for employees gained through our expansion until we establish ourselves as a vendor.

    Other ways you can help

    Even if you can't contribute, please share our campaign. Like us on Facebook! Follow us on instagram! Create awareness. Every word spread contributes to the cause!

Any money raised over our goal will allow us to kickstart pay for employees gained through our expansion until we establish ourselves as a vendor.

story:
How We Got Here

When the owner of Sola Cafe &  Market, Tiffany Lach moved to Bozeman, she noticed the need more fresh, healthy and delicious food options. Having a passion for flavor and a background in the biz, she was driven to be a part of this change. In 2008 Sola Cafe opened to oohs and ahs and lines out the door. Sola offered a fresh alternative to that era of Bozeman. Throughout the past ten years, Sola has responded to the tastes of their growing community while watching the cafe-bakery trend blanket the town. Tiffany noticed more and more people craving veg-forward, bold flavored, beautiful food—food that stands on the merits of its freshness and high-quality ingredients—food that is as easy to take on the go as it is to sit and enjoy over a long conversation. Food that she loves to offer at Sola. 

Where We Are Heading

Our focus remains 100% on our community and customers. Based on customer feedback from the last decade,  we are aiming to refine Sola, creating an experience that you crave and enjoy! Everything from the flow, food and ordering process will be reimagined based on what we have heard you say WE WANT!  

The Sola 2x concept presents an ever-changing array of fresh, prepared offerings. You will order from a visual display, based on the size portion and variety you desire. This presentation will be the perfect blend of efficiency and a healthy and delicious meal to stay or to go.

First, you’ll peruse the day’s offerings. Stacks of fresh-made sandwiches, urns of soups, braised meat dishes, poached wild-caught fish, and a plethora of seasonal veg salads.

Second, you’ll pick your combo size. How hungry are you? Who do you need to feed? Are you taking food to the office or to a party? 

Combo Examples

Our combo sizes allow the customer to order exactly what they want. No guess work here! Our entire offerings are ready to be mixed and matched to make the perfect meal. Let us pack your lunch or put together a dinner for four.  

Thirdly, we'll serve you your delicious meal right then and there. Always fresh. No waiting. 

Next, head on into the dining room with your food and ENJOY! Or... if you’re taking things to-go, head to the treats case, pay and get on your way.  

Back in the dining room... Save room for dessert!  When you’re ready to take off peek at our bakery offerings. Our case is full of hand-baked treats with many gluten or dairy/egg free choices.

We will also offer ready to go breakfast sandwiches on house-made whole grain english muffins or bagels made fresh and waiting for you to fuel your work or play. Or on the weekends, come on in for BRUNCH.  Hit the waffle or omelet bar or try a weekend chef’s breakfast skillet. You’ll love how easy it is to feed everyone in the group just as they like. Don't forget to stop by the new tea bar or grab an espresso. 

Sticking to our Roots 

Local artisans, farmers, ranches, and dairies have a place in our hearts. Without them, Sola would not exist. We are keeping this a main focus in these new changes. We want everyone to be able to enjoy our food and these gifts from the Earth, and our new concept will allow for that more easily. We aim to provide Bozeman with outstanding food that is delicious and locally-minded.

Our community will always be the inspiration. We will continue to give back to Bozeman through our partnerships, donations, and charity programs. Learn more about this philosophy here.

Thank you for an amazing first ten years! We are joyfully stirring up the new Sola 2X for you! There are many costs involved in making this menu change. We’re doing it as sustainably as we can. We raised some friends and family funds to make the first wave happen and are looking to our community to help too!  Please take a look at our crowdfunding levels and perhaps find a way to make this yours!  Sola has been a ten-year labor of love and we continue to exist to serve YOU our beautiful community!  It is truly an honor to do our small part to make our world a little more kind and delightful each and every day. We are ALL in this together. Enjoy!

story:
We believe in "the village" -- that it takes many great minds and hearts working together to raise children who are at their best, and good, and healthy, and kind; children who are ready to learn, open to new experiences, and excited about how they will change the world.  We believe that healthy eating, with meals full of nutrient-dense foods and natural flavors are critical to this goal.  EasyPeasie is our contribution to the village, and to training the palates of our future leaders.  With EasyPeasie, we endeavor to make it easier to make kids healthier by making meals “veggier!”  We care about kids’ nutrition, and have made it our mission to provide families fun, simple, natural, and easy ways to improve every meal with added vegetable nutrition! Today, we need your support to make our dream of having EasyPeasie help every family a reality.

We are Jamelah and Dorielle; sisters by birth, friends by grace.  We are the founders and owners of Easy Peasie, LLC.  A pediatrician, an engineer, and a mother between us -- we are natural problem-solvers and advocates for children and community.  When one of Dorielle’s babies needed to transition to formula so she could return to work, we didn’t want his palate to suffer.  Pediatric and nutrition studies show that as toddlers, formula-fed babies are less adventurous with new foods and flavors than their breast-fed counterparts.  We put our heads together (our village of two!) and came up with the plan to dry and grind a variety of vegetables in order to give him vegetable exposures starting in infancy.  Though we didn’t know it at the time, this was also the infancy of EasyPeasie. 

EasyPeasie Veggie Blends are our custom blends of dried and ground vegetables.  We call it EasyPeasie because it’s an easy way to add extra veggie nutrition to food and drinks, and we have peas in all of our blends.  The veggie combinations in each blend are specially selected to maximize nutrition and minimize “veggie taste.”  The blends are all natural, with no added sugar, no preservatives, no artificial colors nor flavors.  They are naturally gluten-free, dairy-free, and vegan.  EasyPeasie is pediatrician-, mom-, and picky eater- approved!  The blends currently on the market are: “Natural Veggie Blend” (carrots, peas, sweet potatoes) and “EasyPeasie Plus Green Blend” (carrots, peas, sweet potatoes, kale, and spinach).  Our new Red Blend with beets is available in limited supply through the Fall and Winter.

We celebrate the veggie-successes of our families!  With the help of our EasyPeasie reciPEAS, our families have added extra veggie nutrition to a variety of food and drinks: applesauce, oatmeal, pizza, quesadillas, rice, sauces, soups, smoothies, milk, pancakes, burgers, eggs, and more!  Our convenient packaging allows families to take their veggies "on-the-go."  We like to think of EasyPeasie as veggies in the best combination of convenience, shelf-life, and great nutrition!

We are proud to have been featured in nutrition videos with the Afropolitan Chef and with cutting-edge concierge office, Boca VIPediatrics.  Find us in South Florida Parenting, MadameNoire, Vitamin Retailer, and PeekABoo Family Magazines; including being named one of PeekABoo Magazine’s “Favorite Things” and South Florida Parenting's "Stuff We Love."  

We are based out of our hometown of Hallandale Beach, Florida.  Currently, families can get EasyPeasie by meeting us at our local farmers’ markets in South and Central Florida, or ordering online at easypeasie.com. 

Our goal is to help as many families as possible make meals veggier with EasyPeasie.  We know how excited our current families are to improve every meal with added vegetable nutrition.  We want all families to have that excitement and reassurance that getting veggies in can be EASY!  Our fundraising goal of $38,500 will help us accomplish the following…

  • Increased promotion and exposure (demonstration videos, website refinement, participation in trade shows/conferences in 2017)
  • New blend development and procurement
  • Preparation of product lines for retail
  • Focused consumer and market research
  • Our community service projects (support of community gardens/urban farming programs to combat food deserts, mentorship and nutrition education in the community)
  • Development of an EasyPeasie App (great nutritional resource for families)

If we do not reach our full goal, product promotion, preparation for retail, and new blend development will be prioritized.

At the various levels of support, enjoy some of the perks we have pictured below, including gift-wrapped EasyPeasie Veggie Blends, T-shirts, tote bags, swag, and gift cards.

 

Your support of this project will help us:

  • Make it easier to make kids healthier by making meals “veggier!”
  • Introduce more families to EasyPeasie, and allow EasyPeasie to be available to more families
  • Be a helpful resource for families of children with special needs and feeding difficulties
  • Expand our efforts to educate families and communities on the benefits of vegetables and good nutrition, including teaching healthy eating as a way to combat obesity
  • Bring more blends to market
  • Get more people to like, then love vegetables!

Our main challenges are two: (1) educating our market about palate priming and the benefits of EasyPeasie Veggie Blends, and (2) reaching more families outside of our local markets.  As doctors in the fields of pediatrics and engineering, my sister and I are well-versed in problem solving.  We are laser-focused on creating the best, most socially-responsible, highest-quality product for our families, and making our brand synonymous with our passion for this work, our attention to detail, and our care and concern for our families and kids.

If you're unable to support us financially, but you still want to support this campaign, here is how you can help!

  • Invite us to speak to your Mommy Groups and Nutrition/Health related community programs
  • Follow and Like us on:
    • Facebook -  facebook.com/easypeasie
    • Instagram -  @easypeasieco
    • Twitter - @easypeasieco
    • Pinterest - @easypeasieco
    • YouTube - youtube.com/c/easypeasieco
  • Submit your reviews and feedback of EasyPeasie on our website or social media pages
  • If interested in selling EasyPeasie in your office or store, contact us at contact@easypeasie.com
  • Share, share, share this Indiegogo campaign with family and friends
story_txt:
We believe in "the village" -- that it takes many great minds and hearts working together to raise children who are at their best, and good, and healthy, and kind; children who are ready to learn, open to new experiences, and excited about how they will change the world.  We believe that healthy eating, with meals full of nutrient-dense foods and natural flavors are critical to this goal.  EasyPeasie is our contribution to the village, and to training the palates of our future leaders.  With EasyPeasie, we endeavor to make it easier to make kids healthier by making meals “veggier!”  We care about kids’ nutrition, and have made it our mission to provide families fun, simple, natural, and easy ways to improve every meal with added vegetable nutrition! Today, we need your support to make our dream of having EasyPeasie help every family a reality.We are Jamelah and Dorielle; sisters by birth, friends by grace.  We are the founders and owners of Easy Peasie, LLC.  A pediatrician, an engineer, and a mother between us -- we are natural problem-solvers and advocates for children and community.  When one of Dorielle’s babies needed to transition to formula so she could return to work, we didn’t want his palate to suffer.  Pediatric and nutrition studies show that as toddlers, formula-fed babies are less adventurous with new foods and flavors than their breast-fed counterparts.  We put our heads together (our village of two!) and came up with the plan to dry and grind a variety of vegetables in order to give him vegetable exposures starting in infancy.  Though we didn’t know it at the time, this was also the infancy of EasyPeasie. EasyPeasie Veggie Blends are our custom blends of dried and ground vegetables.  We call it EasyPeasie because it’s an easy way to add extra veggie nutrition to food and drinks, and we have peas in all of our blends.  The veggie combinations in each blend are specially selected to maximize nutrition and minimize “veggie taste.”  The blends are all natural, with no added sugar, no preservatives, no artificial colors nor flavors.  They are naturally gluten-free, dairy-free, and vegan.  EasyPeasie is pediatrician-, mom-, and picky eater- approved!  The blends currently on the market are: “Natural Veggie Blend” (carrots, peas, sweet potatoes) and “EasyPeasie Plus Green Blend” (carrots, peas, sweet potatoes, kale, and spinach).  Our new Red Blend with beets is available in limited supply through the Fall and Winter.We celebrate the veggie-successes of our families!  With the help of our EasyPeasie reciPEAS, our families have added extra veggie nutrition to a variety of food and drinks: applesauce, oatmeal, pizza, quesadillas, rice, sauces, soups, smoothies, milk, pancakes, burgers, eggs, and more!  Our convenient packaging allows families to take their veggies "on-the-go."  We like to think of EasyPeasie as veggies in the best combination of convenience, shelf-life, and great nutrition!We are proud to have been featured in nutrition videos with the Afropolitan Chef and with cutting-edge concierge office, Boca VIPediatrics.  Find us in South Florida Parenting, MadameNoire, Vitamin Retailer, and PeekABoo Family Magazines; including being named one of PeekABoo Magazine’s “Favorite Things” and South Florida Parenting's "Stuff We Love."  We are based out of our hometown of Hallandale Beach, Florida.  Currently, families can get EasyPeasie by meeting us at our local farmers’ markets in South and Central Florida, or ordering online at easypeasie.com. Our goal is to help as many families as possible make meals veggier with EasyPeasie.  We know how excited our current families are to improve every meal with added vegetable nutrition.  We want all families to have that excitement and reassurance that getting veggies in can be EASY!  Our fundraising goal of $38,500 will help us accomplish the following…
Increased promotion and exposure (demonstration videos, website refinement, participation in trade shows/conferences in 2017)
New blend development and procurement
Preparation of product lines for retail
Focused consumer and market research
Our community service projects (support of community gardens/urban farming programs to combat food deserts, mentorship and nutrition education in the community)
Development of an EasyPeasie App (great nutritional resource for families)
If we do not reach our full goal, product promotion, preparation for retail, and new blend development will be prioritized.At the various levels of support, enjoy some of the perks we have pictured below, including gift-wrapped EasyPeasie Veggie Blends, T-shirts, tote bags, swag, and gift cards. Your support of this project will help us:
Make it easier to make kids healthier by making meals “veggier!”
Introduce more families to EasyPeasie, and allow EasyPeasie to be available to more families
Be a helpful resource for families of children with special needs and feeding difficulties
Expand our efforts to educate families and communities on the benefits of vegetables and good nutrition, including teaching healthy eating as a way to combat obesity
Bring more blends to market
Get more people to like, then love vegetables!
Our main challenges are two: (1) educating our market about palate priming and the benefits of EasyPeasie Veggie Blends, and (2) reaching more families outside of our local markets.  As doctors in the fields of pediatrics and engineering, my sister and I are well-versed in problem solving.  We are laser-focused on creating the best, most socially-responsible, highest-quality product for our families, and making our brand synonymous with our passion for this work, our attention to detail, and our care and concern for our families and kids.If you're unable to support us financially, but you still want to support this campaign, here is how you can help!
Invite us to speak to your Mommy Groups and Nutrition/Health related community programs
Follow and Like us on:
Facebook -  facebook.com/easypeasie

Instagram -  @easypeasieco

Twitter - @easypeasieco

Pinterest - @easypeasieco

YouTube - youtube.com/c/easypeasieco



Submit your reviews and feedback of EasyPeasie on our website or social media pages
If interested in selling EasyPeasie in your office or store, contact us at contact@easypeasie.com
Share, share, share this Indiegogo campaign with family and friends

story:
What is Honey & Roses Coffee Co.?

Honey & Roses Coffee Co. is about more than just coffee. We are a community of small businesses and coffee lovers. We've created an online marketplace that gives you access to the best small batch craft coffee roasters around the USA. All of our partners emphasize ethical Coffee sourcing and offer fair trade, organic or work with family run coffee farms when possible. We are a website that allows you to compare the coffees at a glance, our goal is to assist you to find something that works for your taste buds. We offer coffee samples,  that way you feel confident in the quality before you commit to a larger bag. Every order is roasted fresh and sent out directly to you. This is not coffee sitting in a warehouse for months before it lands on the shelves.

We want to maintain a personal touch, whether you are new to small batch coffee or a connoisseur, we will give personal recommendations based on our experience  and flavor preferences. We will point you to something that suits you personally, hoping  our marketplace will be your final stop for all your craft coffee needs.

We would like to think we are more than just coffee. We're incredibly passionate about eco friendly and sustainable lifestyle and have curated an entire collection based upon this vision. Our home goods are beautifully crafted by artisans across the world, many from disadvantaged communities who do not have a way to reach an international market. With sustainability and effeciancy in mind these items are perfect to gift, or enjoy with your coffee. We offer an array of home items, from resuable water bottle to cutlery. We also are trying to cultivate a group of small batch artisans in the US and we have recently launched homemade coffee scrubs, artisan chocolate and more.

To learn more about us and see our project in action you can check out the link at  https://honeyandrosescoffee.com/pages/our-story Feel free to reach out to us directly with any questions!

Why are we raising funds?

We have seen fantastic progress since we launched last June, we now have partnered with over 40 small batch Coffee Roasters. And are working with multiple local artisan and creators for our home goods collection. We have now reached a point where we cannot progress further without your support.

In the past few months, with the COVID-19 pandemic driving a huge surge in the online coffee market, large coffee corporations with eyewatering marketing budgets have made it increasingly difficult to reach our market and share our coffee community with all of you. Our existing and loyal customers come back time and again, but we are only able to grow our community if people are able to find us online.  We want to be able to share the positive impact and help assist the whole supply chain, from the farmers that lovingly grow the beans, to the roasters that expertly roast the coffee - all the way to you enjoying your morning cup.

  • $28,000 will allow us to hire a part time marketing analyst/contributors to optimise our campaigns across platforms, conduct efficient trend analysis and diversify our marketing strategy.
  • A further $30,000 allows us to increase our marketing spend, and helps us overcome the smokescreen created by corporate backed advertising and prevents our small businesses from getting the exposure they need.

We are constantly sold out of our reusable cups and home products. Our products are excellent quality, which comes with a cost. Sourced all over the world in the search for the most beautiful products around, there is often a 6 week + lead time from order to receipt.

  • $27,000 will allow us to make significant upfront purchases from our artisans, and hold the goods in the US reducing our community's frustrations at long wait times and reducing the number of shipments we need to have transported, which helps reduce our carbon footprint. We will also be able to enhance our range of sustainable home products.

We welcome questions or comments on either our company, our goals, or our fundraising campaign and encourage you to reach out to us via the website.

Thanks for your support and Happy Brewing!

Joe & Ella

XOXO

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone will be able to contribute financially, but you can still help us. Just following us on social media, sharing our content and recommending us to friends and family helps us hugely!

story:
Press

Why Do I Need CHiP?

Perfect Cookies, Every Time

What is a Perfect Cookie?

Texture, aroma, warm and always fresh–CHiP bakes it how you want. He's able to sense the internal temperature throughout the baking process, so you can customize your cookie preferences.

We've got a cookie for everyone! From college students to working moms or dads, CHiP is a great fit for your diet and lifestyle.

How Does It Work?

Our Gourmet Cookie Dough

Goodbye clean up! No need to mix dough, clean mixers, bowls, measuring cups or spoons. Just drop our ready made dough into CHiP and you're done. 

We believe in responsible packaging without sacrificing convenience. We'll be using environmentally-friendly packaging and are experimenting with biodegradable parchment paper wrappers.

Can I Use My Own Dough?

Absolutely! Have your own go-to or secret family recipe? No worries, you can bake those cookies in CHiP too! He has a manual mode where you can customize the time and temperature to ensure that your dough recipes turn out just the way you like. Best of all, you can save and name your settings for next time.

The removable Non-Stick PFOA and PTFE-Free Baking Tray is 10" and dishwasher-safe which allows for a minimal clean-up baking experience.

How is CHiP Better than Other Ovens?

There are several features that make CHiP a truly Smart Oven, such as:

Delay Start Mode allows you to start baking anytime within 4 hours of setting the dough into CHiP. Put the cookies in during your lunch break, before a workout or for a nice afternoon snack. 

Worry-Free Cooking lets you go ahead and enjoy the party! Never burn cookies again, CHiP will automatically start cooling down at the right time and can even keep them warm for up to 2 hours.

CookieGram™ Send a video or text CookieGram that can be viewed after CHiP has finished baking. A warm cookie and personal message is the perfect gift to wish someone luck on a big day or to celebrate everyday moments.

The CHiP mobile app, powered by SideChef, provides an easy, fun and intuitive way to customize your cookie preferences.

  • Know when cookies are done with app notifications.
  • Order dough through the CHiP app so you're ready whenever a cookie craving hits.
  • No need to set time or temperature. The app knows precisely how to bake different kinds of cookies perfectly.

How Did We Do It?

CHiP's patent pending QuickConvect™ Air Flow System has a 4” convection fan that blows hot air through specially designed air channels. This eliminates hot and cool spots, and ensures hot air flows around the oven at a consistent, even temperature to reduce cooking time.

Instant Preheat: CHiP’s condensed oven cavity, combined with the air flow system and powerful heating element allows the temperature to rise to desired levels much faster than a conventional oven, saving you time. 

Carbon Fiber Convection Heating Element (1300W) is more energy efficient than traditional electric elements and heats up instantly. 

Intelligent Baking: Different cookies go through different chemical reactions as they bake, CHiP detects the temperature at all times to ensure that each cookie is perfectly baked.

CHiP is a space saver. He is smaller than most countertop appliances and fits in pretty much anywhere. 

Designed to Fit Your Lifestyle

Whether you want cookies for breakfast at home, with a coffee in your office, as an energy boost after the gym, or to share with guests, CHiP is there for you!

What Are the Dough Flavors?

From gluten-free to vegan options, choose from a huge variety of flavors.

  • Our ready-made dough produces gourmet sized cookies, larger than your regular store-bought varieties.
  • We are committed to sourcing the finest ingredients. Rest assured we'll always be transparent about our dough.
  • Can’t decide on a flavor? We'll have packs of assorted flavors, with CHiP being able to cook each one perfectly at the same time.
  • Choose the number that suits you. Bake up to four cookies, or even just one.

We’re working with our team of cookie experts to create a cookie dough wishlist. From Classic to Premium, find your favorite flavor.

** Availability is subject to manufacturing limitations.

Choose from an à la carte or subscription. Our ready-made dough will be sold in packs of 4 pods each, and subscriptions will include 4 packs per month.

** Delivers to anywhere in the Continental US. Taxes and shipping not included.

We're Starting with Cookies, but Have Bigger Plans!

Who is CHiP?

CHiP is not only smart, he has personality. He will interact with you throughout the baking process. When you connect with the CHiP app, he’ll remember your favorite cookies, remind you to order more dough, and even greet you on your birthday!

Energy Saving

If only 5% of the estimated 2 billion* cookies consumed by Americans were baked with CHiP, as opposed to using a traditional oven, we could save:

*Source: http://whatscookingamerica.net, http://energy.gov and http://EPA.gov

Additional Features

Capacitive Touch Switches provide a simple and intuitive user interface that can control CHiP manually, even if a mobile device or internet connection is unavailable.

Multi-Color LEDs are colorful, fun and indicate CHiP’s current status.

Tempered Glass Lid allows you to witness the magic of your cookie creations.

1-Year Warranty: SideChef will replace CHiP if anything fails within one year from delivery.

Wi-Fi Internet Connection (802.11ac) allows for the fastest possible secure connection between mobile device, CHiP and the cloud. 

Remote Firmware Updates allow delivery of new software innovations and upgrades—even after your purchase.  

Smart Home Integration syncs up with Smart Home systems like Alexa.

 

International 220V CHiP

We're also designing a 220V international model which will retail for US$299.

 

Design Process

Early Concept Sketches

It all starts with an idea. We settled on cookies because we love them, and an estimated 95% of all American households eat cookies! We wanted to reexamine that whole experience and see how we could make it faster, easier, better, and more fun. We wanted a compact appliance that would deliver freshly baked healthy or indulgent cookies in 10 minutes or less with no preparation or clean-up.

First Prototype

To begin with, we created our first working prototype with components from off-the-shelf convection ovens. We first tested the ovens and took them apart to see how they worked. They were all designed to deliver heat from the top, which isn’t a great way to bake cookies because temperatures are so uneven. With baking or convection baking, the primary heat source should be on the bottom.

Early 3D Concepts

Once we proved we could actually make some great cookies using affordable off-the-shelf components, we decided to give the design a try. We started with a lot of high-tech concepts that seem a bit wacky in retrospect, but finally decided on one that would be simple, practical and relatively cost-effective. The round shape is ideal for helping the convection air spread uniformly without any hot or cold spots.

Second Prototype

With this prototype, we wanted to fine-tune the performance and get more specific with the materials and dimensions. We played around with lots of baking trays to create ideal air flow. We also hooked up to an Arduino board to improve the software, cooking cycle and sensor control. Oh yeah, and we also baked (and ate) lots of cookies.

Final Prototype

Once we proved we could cook great cookies in just about 10 minutes using accessible, affordable components, we were excited to bring CHiP to life with details that would give him character. We gave him a couple of touch switches for eyes and an LED strip for a mouth. We spent a lot of time improving the user experience by combining sounds, lights, cooking functions and the mobile app design to work together seamlessly for a fun, simple and convenient cooking experience.

 

Technical Specifications

Color: 

  • Pure White with Light Gray Trim

Product Dimensions: 

  • 12” Diameter x 6.5” Height

Item Weight: 

  • 6 pounds

Carton Dimensions: 

  • 14” x 14” x 8.5”

Shipping Weight: 

  • 8 pounds

Materials: 

  • Lid: Glass 
  • Body: White Enameled Metal 
  • Base: Light Gray Enameled Metal 
  • Baking Tray: Non-stick PFOA and PTFE Free Coated Aluminum

Sound: 

  • 2W speaker
  • 16 bit/44.1Khz DAC

WiFi Frequency: 

  • 802.11 b/g/n 
  • 2.4-2.5 GHz/5 GHz

Security Type: 

  • WEP/TKIP/AES

Security Mechanism:

  • WEP/WPA-PSK/WPA2-PSK

Electrical Specification: 

  • 120 V/60 Hz 
  • 220 V/50 Hz
  • Max. Load Current: 15A
  • Rated Power: 1800W

Safety Marks/Certifications:

  • CE, ETL CUS, FCC

 

About Us

Why You Should Back CHiP

Now we need your help to bring CHiP to life. CHiP is great for anyone who loves cookies, and it belongs in your office, home, dorm room, hotel room, real estate open house, Airbnb, airport lounge, food truck, anywhere and everywhere cookies can be enjoyed!

 

Risks and challenges

Agency Requirements

One challenge will be meeting all of the latest agency requirements for smart household appliances. We are designing for, testing to, and will meet all requirements in the UL 1026 Standard in the U.S. and are also planning to meet CE and CCC requirements for Europe and China. Our CPO comes from a major U.S. appliance manufacturer and has first-hand experience with agency testing and certification for ovens, including the first Wi-Fi connected ovens and ranges for the U.S. market.

Internet Security

Another important challenge will be internet security and continuous security updates. While connecting to the internet brings great features such as remote software updates, remote control, and our new Scan-n-Cook™ feature, it also exposes an appliance to the internet. Our CTO has great experience with internet security, having been a leader at a virtual currency trading company where security was mission critical.

Timeline

Probably our biggest potential risk is losing the support of our backers and we believe that delivering a product on time with outstanding quality will be critical to our success. We think we are conservative with our production timeline and hope to get it out sooner than planned.

 

(Credit: selected icons from icons8.com)

With baking or convection baking, the primary heat source should be on the bottom.Early 3D ConceptsOnce we proved we could actually make some great cookies using affordable off-the-shelf components, we decided to give the design a try. We started with a lot of high-tech concepts that seem a bit wacky in retrospect, but finally decided on one that would be simple, practical and relatively cost-effective. The round shape is ideal for helping the convection air spread uniformly without any hot or cold spots.Second PrototypeWith this prototype, we wanted to fine-tune the performance and get more specific with the materials and dimensions. We played around with lots of baking trays to create ideal air flow. We also hooked up to an Arduino board to improve the software, cooking cycle and sensor control. Oh yeah, and we also baked (and ate) lots of cookies.Final PrototypeOnce we proved we could cook great cookies in just about 10 minutes using accessible, affordable components, we were excited to bring CHiP to life with details that would give him character. We gave him a couple of touch switches for eyes and an LED strip for a mouth. We spent a lot of time improving the user experience by combining sounds, lights, cooking functions and the mobile app design to work together seamlessly for a fun, simple and convenient cooking experience. Technical SpecificationsColor: Pure White with Light Gray TrimProduct Dimensions: 12” Diameter x 6.5” HeightItem Weight: 6 poundsCarton Dimensions: 14” x 14” x 8.5”Shipping Weight: 8 poundsMaterials: 
Lid: Glass 
Body: White Enameled Metal 
Base: Light Gray Enameled Metal 
Baking Tray: Non-stick PFOA and PTFE Free Coated Aluminum
Sound: 
2W speaker
16 bit/44.1Khz DAC
WiFi Frequency: 
802.11 b/g/n 
2.4-2.5 GHz/5 GHz
Security Type: WEP/TKIP/AESSecurity Mechanism:WEP/WPA-PSK/WPA2-PSKElectrical Specification: 
120 V/60 Hz 
220 V/50 Hz
Max. Load Current: 15A
Rated Power: 1800W
Safety Marks/Certifications:CE, ETL CUS, FCC About UsWhy You Should Back CHiPNow we need your help to bring CHiP to life. CHiP is great for anyone who loves cookies, and it belongs in your office, home, dorm room, hotel room, real estate open house, Airbnb, airport lounge, food truck, anywhere and everywhere cookies can be enjoyed! Risks and challengesAgency RequirementsOne challenge will be meeting all of the latest agency requirements for smart household appliances. We are designing for, testing to, and will meet all requirements in the UL 1026 Standard in the U.S. and are also planning to meet CE and CCC requirements for Europe and China. Our CPO comes from a major U.S. appliance manufacturer and has first-hand experience with agency testing and certification for ovens, including the first Wi-Fi connected ovens and ranges for the U.S. market.Internet SecurityAnother important challenge will be internet security and continuous security updates. While connecting to the internet brings great features such as remote software updates, remote control, and our new Scan-n-Cook™ feature, it also exposes an appliance to the internet. Our CTO has great experience with internet security, having been a leader at a virtual currency trading company where security was mission critical.TimelineProbably our biggest potential risk is losing the support of our backers and we believe that delivering a product on time with outstanding quality will be critical to our success. We think we are conservative with our production timeline and hope to get it out sooner than planned. (Credit: selected icons from icons8.com)

story:
The Trans-Fat-Free, Shake-To-Drink Milk Tea

 

Dear Indiegogo backers, our products are already made and ready to ship. Our team is a long time fan for the crowdfunding community and we'd like to give back with honest & discounted offers. Enjoy now!

A ground-breaking 100% fresh, zero trans fat shake-to-drink milk tea.

We provide an experience where you can bring all the best ingredients with you, easily shake into delicious milk tea wherever and whenever you want a sip!

Unlike typical milk tea in the market which uses powders and artificial flavors, we believe that the best milk tea can only be made from high-grade, fresh-brewed tea leaves. Thus, we only collect the competition-grade, first harvest tea from their true origins such as Fujian China, and Sri Lanka. Then, the local farmers use a low-heat baking process to help develop the aroma of the tea and make sure every brew brings the best flavor even to critique standards. After countless experiments and tastings, we are confident that OhTea delivers the best tea flavor that guarantees your satisfaction.

Our packaging withstands high heat from hot water so it serves as both packaging and container. We put ingredients into this uniquely designed bag that seals the fresh flavors. All you need to do is pouring warm or cold water to make everything alive and shake it to blend everything together. We also strongly recommend throwing the milk tea into the refrigerator for 2 hours after you shake it to enjoy the ice-cold version!

The package can lock the fresh taste for hours long, so there’s no more hassle of finishing your milk tea after opening - take a delicious sip whenever, wherever you like and bring it with you all day long!

 

The freedom to make the milk tea of your own style

You can enjoy our product ice or hot, strong or light, whichever way you like! If you are tired of the preset sweetness level and taste of the RTD drinks, you would definitely love the way Ohtea is designed. If you want a stronger and sweeter taste, you can put hot water into the package, and shake vigorously to let the full taste come out. However, if you are someone who prefers lighter, and less sweet beverages, just use room temperature water to steep, and enjoy when it reaches the sweetness level you desire.

The power of supporting small tea-farmers

At Ohtea, we understand it might be a difficult time for many small business owners. We chose to only partner with small but quality tea-farmers of lesser scale to help them maintain their business growth. We want to carry this mission forward to always support traditional tea-farming techniques and ancient tea-roasting methods. 

 

Our Products

There are three main parts of ingredients in the product: original tea leaves, New Zealand milk powder, and non-dairy powder. For the non-dairy powder part, it does contain ingredients like regular sugar, soybean oil, and palm oil; however, there is no wheat/gluten in the product, and no trans-fat. We selected a premium source of ingredients to only make sure that the products you get from Ohtea taste totally different from the beverages you had before. As soon as you open the package, you can smell the fresh and pleasant aroma of the tea leaves. After the water is added, the tea leaves slowly mix with the milk powder and develop a sweet, creamy, and well-balanced taste of the milk tea that you cannot resist. 

Every tea type has its own magical taste when mixing with the milk, we select the three signature tea types with distinctive aroma and body, and we want to share their origins and uniqueness with you. 

Wuyi black tea is the very first black tea grown in the world originated from the Wuyi Mountain region in China. Wuyi black tea has a signature smoky and fruity flavor and produces a natural honey scent when brewed. The high mineral content of the soil, the humid climate, as well as the narrow valley come together and enable the tea to grow without the risk of scorching or bitterness, but contain rich minerals, vitamins, and antioxidants. The thin, twisted leaves produce a sweet fragrance before steeping; once brewed, the tea offers up aromas of smoky caramel and earthy, rich wheat flavors with a hint of sweetness.

Ceylon black tea refers to the geographical region, Sri Lanka (previously known as Ceylon) is the most famous black tea around the globe. The high-grown black tea offers a bold, full, and brisk palette. It has medium-to-full tannins and some notes of citrus, chocolate, or spice. Ceylon is among the best teas which have a distinct flavor, aroma, and strength with a burgundy brown body.

Four Seasons Oolong tea is a high-mountain tea that has been hand-picked and hand-processed by traditional methods. For typical tea types, only the first harvest of the year produces the best tea flavor. However, Four Seasons Oolong remains the same quality all year round. The tea body is extremely smooth and light. When brewed, it has a delightful floral and sweet taste with a stronger creamy finish.

Why We Did It

It’s simply not possible to have a great tea shop right next to you. Every time when we want fresh milk tea, we have to go through a long and painful line. How about those on the grocery shelf? Sadly, the convenient beverages are artificially flavored, and … freshly brewed tea is always the best. Oh, you can definitely order delivery, but what about the associated cost... does it make you hesitate every time you place an order?

What if there is a new way of making fresh and delicious milk tea so that we can enjoy it whenever and wherever without compromising its taste? Boom, we have created the perfect solution: OhTea, and it changes everything.

In the journey of crafting our shake-to-drink tea beverage, we have tasted the best products in the market and been through 15 iterations of design and prototyping. It’s hard to find the best ingredients from origins such as Fujian, China, and Sri Lanka, and even harder to produce balanced recipes. The team has physically assembled, tested, and debated which is the “right” drink to “wow” you, our friend, and tea lover.

BTW, you might not even know, Shake-to-drink milk tea has already become a phenomenon in Asian countries like China and Korea. Join us, and the millions of shake-to-drink tea lovers; Let's Make Milkea Great Again! ;)

 

What We Need & What You Get

We come from diverse backgrounds and are all passionate about tea. Although we work in different industries--tech, art, business--we deeply care about what we drink and what we deliver to you.

We believe the best product can only be made from the best ingredients. Ohtea is committed to actively engage these tea farmers and deliver the most authentic taste without the middleman. One sip is all you need to tell the difference.

We think the best design does not need to be sophisticated - our ideal is to make great products that are simple to make and fun to indulge. Thus, we are proud to bring you this shake-to-drink tea - delicious, freshly made by YOU to enjoy anytime, anywhere!

We are asking $5,000 to kickstart our manufacturing & supply chain. And we are aiming for $15,000 to make our product a real business. Our plan is to deliver the first batch to our Kickstarter supporters and scale-out the production size and start selling online - make this great product available to every corner of the world.

Lastly...

I vaguely remember those years, when I had long working hours and high labor intensity, and felt that I couldn't make it, it was just a cup of milk tea, which allowed the afternoon shift to continue and recharge my body and soul. Such simple happiness makes the afternoon sunshine even more bright. Looking for that pleasant temperature in your intense life, you can always continue to move forward. In this sense, milk tea is a spiritual beverage.

From the old Tea Horse Road to the world-famous milk tea, the passion for tea never stopped. Originated from China, now onto the World, we know Ohtea.co brings you not only tasty products but also an embodiment of the culture that brings people together. When we meet new friends from different backgrounds, we’d love to welcome everyone with a cup of tea, extending our love and respect.

Risks & Challenges

We take your trust in us seriously and are so excited to welcome you as part of this journey. By the end of our campaign, we will be ready to release the pledge manager for our backers so we can start the manufacturing process as soon as possible. Although we have accounted for possible issues that may arise during shipping, customs, and manufacturing, we strive for transparency and will communicate the successes and challenges we encounter at a minimum of monthly updates. We're committed to you in each step of this journey, and appreciate your overwhelming support and accountability as our backers. Thanks for your constant encouragement as we continue to expand the wonderful world of tea! COVID-19: Our production partner and other suppliers are back to normal since the beginning of May 2020, so we don't expect any delays as of right now. We're closely monitoring the situation and will provide you with regular updates if any delays occur. Thanks for being so tea-rrific!

story:
La crepe a moi

Hello, Bonjour.  We are Dj and Rebecca Dahmani, a French/American family that is La crepe a moi.  La crepe a moi has been going to San Francisco Bay Area Farmers Markets for 10 years.  We serve freshly made organic sweet and organic savory gluten-free crepes with fresh locally sourced ingredients.  We have found a brick-and-mortar at 1854 Euclid Ave, in Berkeley California across from the University of Berkeley.   La crepe a moi will be a positive impact in the community with good food and good service.  Berkeley will be proud to have us.  This has been our dream to build a creperie/restaurant.  We have launched this campaign to ask for your help and share in our dream coming true.  

 

 

IT'S A TOTAL BUILD OUT OF OUR CREPERIE RESTAURANT 

      

 

   We  secured the space with a deposit and signed a lease, hired an architect  and paid for our       permits for the city of Berkeley.  
  Hired a hood specialist to install the 2 hoods and HVAC make air

  We hired a contractor to do the work...

  • Install rough plumbing
  • Wire the whole restaurant with electricity
  • Prime and paint the walls and ceiling
  • Build a full Kitchen with prep and storage area and a dropped ceiling
  • Install FRP panels on the kitchen walls
  • Install tile flooring in kitchen area
  • Install wood flooring in dining area
  • Build  a counter top with sneeze guard and wheel chair accessible  customer service counter. 

 

INDIEGOGO FUNDS OF  $30,000    

WITH THE FUNDS YOU WILL HELP US TO BUY THE RESTAURANT EQUIPMENT

       4 wire shelves, 3 wall mounted shelves, 1 stainless steel wall cabinet

                   3 stainless steel work tables

                  2 hand wash sinks, 1 three-compartment sink, 1 food preparation sink, 1 mop sink,

                  1 grease interceptor

                  1 coffee maker, 1 waffle maker

                  1 four burner gas stove

                  1 undercounter dishwasher

                  1  75 gallon gas water heater

                  1 six tiers employee lockers

                  1 20 quart mixer, 3 electric crepe makers

                  1 ice machine

                  1 Reach-in two-door refrigerator, 1 three-door undercounter refrigerator

                  tables and chairs

We are asking for your donations to finish our creperie/restaurant, we would like to raise $30,000.

We have perks, ranging from just a small donation a hand written thank you to private catering with in the Bay Area and of course a Donors Soiree.

            Risks and Challenges

We are confident that this campaign is going to fund - in the event we are not able to - it might take us longer to finish our build-out.  

Thank you for your support.  We are continuing our markets:  

Tuesdays in Concord, Todos Santos Plaza  10am to 2pm

Saturday : San Leandro, Bay Fair Center 9am to 1pm

Sundays in Oakland, Jack London Square 10am to 3pm

   &  Kensington, Colusa Circle 10am to 2pm

www.lacrepeamoi.com

 

Thank you so much for all your time and help.

story:
• Meet the owner-     Carey Ella Bor

I am a married mom of two amazing girls. I spend my time during the warmer months selling Maine made ice cream and frozen treats from a little pink mini bus. I sell at farmers markets, birthday parties, weddings, family reunions, a local animal sanctuary and festivals. I have to say it is the best job in the world and besides watching my girls grow and spending time with my family there is nothing that makes me happier. After spending most of my life working in the restaurant business I realized serving people delicious food and making them feel special is what I do. It has always been my dream to own my own business. My first job at the age of 16 was scooping ice cream at a shop in central New York. I never imagined then that I would be driving an ice cream truck for a living.  

It has been a long process of getting this little business going. Every season improvements and maintenance are needed to keep the bus running and looking good. Painting, mechanics, freezers, flooring, new improved sink system, shocks etc.... and every season there are start up costs licenses, vendor fees, insurances etc. This season I want to take on a new project that will help grow my business significantly. I want to produce and market my own brand of fruit pops. I have tested a few flavors, tried a few different kinds of molds and I know that there is a market for my pops. I will locally source my ingredients and sell them on at the farmer markets, local food buying clubs and stores. Any money raised from this campaign will help this little bus to keep rolling along.

I want to thank all of my amazing family and friends who have been a huge support to Fresh Ella's. They have donated money, hosted parties, bought ice cream, helped sell ice cream and so much more. It is because of you that we will be starting a 3rd season.

Thank you in advance for helping with this small business.


MISSION: Spreading happiness by serving  Maine-made frozen treats using locally sourced ingredients and socially conscious products.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Ryan O'Rourke, and I am the founder of Ironclad Coffee Roasters, located in Richmond, Virginia, USA.  We began planning for the establishment of Ironclad in 2015 while still living in Ireland.  Over the course of five years in "The Land of Saints and Scholars," my understanding of what coffee can be was blown wide open by some of the best roasting companies in all of Europe.  We bring a piece of those influences to the east coast of the U.S.A.

Our first (nearly) two years in business have been a resounding success.  Our wholesale partnerships have been popping up all around the Richmond metro area and beyond, and our revenues have increased greatly from year one to year two.  Of course, this doesn't mean we're over here rolling in a pile of money!  We've been fastidious about investing those profits back into the business to keep the growth and momentum going.  We've also been active in sharing those profits with worthy charitable causes and organizations around our own community and in different parts of the world.

This crowdfunding campaign is an essential piece to the process of initiating "Phase Two" of Ironclad.  We have signed a lease on a fantastic historic building in the heart of the city of Richmond, and now we need to begin filling that space with our buildout and equipment that will get the most out of the coffee we roast and serve.  Not long after opening the doors of the roastery, we began to yearn for a place where we could serve and showcase some of the more rare and exquisite single-origin coffees that we are fortunate to source from around the world.

When you invest in this campaign, you are investing in us.  You are investing in people who love their industry, love their community, love to serve, love to educate, and love to give back generously.  We have put together a healthy package of "perks" for investors -- the value of which actually exceed the amount invested in every single case.  We wanted to do this in appreciation for you helping us get "Phase Two" off the ground, and we absolutely cannot do this the right way without buy-in from those of you who have watched us grow from the ground up.  If you believe in us and our product, we can assure you that this next step of Ironclad will only enhance our ability to bring you (and thousands of others) an even higher level of quality in your coffee experiences.

What We Need & What You Get

$25,000 is the goal we have set for this campaign.  The bulk of that will be utilized in the buildout and in purchasing the equipment needed for brewing delicious Ironclad-roasted coffees in the most effective way.  We have seen other businesses raise tens of thousands of dollars with incredibly meager investor perks, so we're confident our generous perk package will be the boost needed to get us up and over our campaign goal!

Please take two or three minutes to peruse the perk options on the right side of this page.  We've tailored the offerings for folks of all kinds, and there is something of great worth for everyone from the casual coffee drinker to the geekiest coffee geek on the planet.

We've opted to go with the flexible funding model, which means we'll still receive whatever our generous investors give.  Of course, that's just an insurance policy, because we still believe this vision and the generous perk offerings will get us to $25,000 and beyond!

The Impact

The obvious impact is more delicious coffee for Richmond (and much further afield for those of you who order from our website).  However, if you are familiar with our passion for charitable giving and community involvement, you'll understand that the impact goes beyond merely great coffee.  Our humble little start-up has been around for less than two years, but we have contributed a little over $20,000 to causes and organizations right here in Richmond, in other states, and even in other countries.  That number will grow as our business grows.  So, if you believe in backing businesses who give back, we would certainly appreciate your investment!

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to your investment, you can help us meet (and exceed) our goal by sharing this campaign page with your friends via social media and email.  There are convenient Indiegogo share tools built right into this page!

Thank you so very much for your generosity and your belief in us and in our vision!
